conflicts: Visual analysis showed no flood evidence while text analysis reported severe flooding.

raw.conflict_resolution: For flood extent, I relied on the text analysis indicating 85% of the area was affected by floodwaters despite visual assessments showing no flooding (as floodwaters had receded). For damage severity, I maintained the text estimate of 80% as the visual analysis found no damage, which does not negate the likelihood of hidden internal damage reported in the text.
raw.reasoning: The text analysis revealed extensive flooding and significant damage claims during the hurricane, supported by numerous real-time reports from residents. Conversely, the visual analysis conducted 3-4 days later showed no evidence of flooding or structural damage, likely due to the timing of the imagery capture after the peak flooding event. As such, I prioritized the text data for both flood extent and damage estimates, while recognizing visual data has limitations in reflecting internal damage.

Estimates indicate that approximately 85% of the area was affected by floodwaters, with an average structural damage severity of 80%. However, it's important to note that visual analysis conducted 3-4 days later showed no visible evidence of flooding or structural damage, necessitating reliance on text data due to the timing of the imagery capture.
